Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Closely follow how CNBC techcheck chooses context to put into the script, the langauge style and sentence structure. Use the same beginning and ending(including mentioning host Wall-E and Tuesday December 10), and replace CNBC techcheck briefing to 'AI briefing' 
 ""

Response:
Script:
i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for tuesday, december 10th. in the latest tech headlines, amazon is ramping up its investment in renewable energy, unveiling plans for three new solar farms and a wind energy project, part of their ambitious pledge to reach net-zero carbon emissions by 2040. the company is leveraging its global scale to push forward sustainability initiatives, hoping to inspire others in the industry to follow suit.

meanwhile, google is making waves with its new ai-driven healthcare tool, set to debut next year. the innovative technology aims to assist healthcare professionals in diagnosing diseases more accurately and efficiently. google says the ai has shown promising results in tests, enhancing the speed and precision of diagnoses.

in other news, microsoft is under pressure as its acquisition of a major gaming company faces regulatory hurdles in the eu. european regulators are closely scrutinizing the deal over antitrust concerns, a move that could significantly delay microsoft's efforts to expand its gaming division.

finally, shares of intel are on the rise after the company announced a breakthrough in their semiconductor technology. intel has developed a new chip design that significantly boosts performance, addressing past concerns over competition from amd and other rivals.

that's all for today. we’ll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
"i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for tuesday, december 10th. amazon is intensifying its commitment to renewable energy, announcing plans for three new solar farms and a wind energy project. this move is part of their ambitious goal to achieve net-zero carbon emissions by 2040. by leveraging their global presence, amazon aims to drive sustainability initiatives and inspire industry-wide change.

switching gears to healthcare, google is set to debut an ai-driven tool next year, designed to enhance the accuracy and efficiency of disease diagnosis for healthcare professionals. the tech giant reports promising test results, indicating improved speed and precision in diagnoses.

in the gaming sector, microsoft faces challenges as its bid to acquire a major gaming company encounters regulatory scrutiny in the eu. european regulators are expressing antitrust concerns, which could potentially delay microsoft's plans to expand its gaming division.

lastly, shares of intel are climbing following the announcement of a breakthrough in semiconductor technology. the company has unveiled a new chip design that significantly enhances performance, addressing previous competition concerns with amd and other rivals.

that's all for today. we’ll see you back here tomorrow."
Podcast Title: EP-169 Amazon's Green Energy 🌍, Google's Ai Healthcare Revolution 🏥, Microsoft's Eu Gaming Hurdle 🎮
Podcast Description:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for tuesday, december 10th! dive into today's top stories:

  • amazon's renewable energy push: amazon announces three new solar farms and a wind energy project as part of their commitment to net-zero carbon emissions by 2040.
  • google's healthcare innovation: google plans to launch an ai-driven tool aimed at improving the accuracy and efficiency of disease diagnosis for healthcare professionals.
  • microsoft's gaming acquisition update: microsoft faces challenges from eu regulators over antitrust concerns regarding their bid to acquire a major gaming company.
  • intel's semiconductor breakthrough: intel reveals a new chip design enhancing performance, boosting their competitive stance against amd and others.

we’ll see you back here tomorrow for more updates!
Image Prompt: a cohesive podcast cover image featuring a dynamic, futuristic cityscape set against a backdrop of abundant greenery and renewable energy sources, symbolizing amazon's commitment to green energy. towering wind turbines and solar panels seamlessly integrate with the urban environment, surrounded by lush forests and clear blue skies. in the foreground, a gleaming hospital building equipped with advanced medical technology represents google's ai healthcare revolution. the hospital emits a soft, ethereal glow, suggesting cutting-edge ai diagnostics at work. to the side, a bustling european city, marked by iconic landmarks, features prominently with a subtle overlay of gaming avatars and consoles, reflecting microsoft's gaming endeavors in europe. the composition merges these elements fluidly, with vibrant energy streams and digital motifs weaving through the scene, creating a harmonious blend of technology, sustainability, and innovation
